intro: Allophylus dimorphus, commonly known as the variable sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are often divided into small, ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, orange-red fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ornamental contexts.
